title: Augmented Lagrangian method
summary: Augmented Lagrangian methods are a certain class of algorithms for solving constrained optimization problems.  They have similarities to penalty methods in that they replace a constrained optimization problem by a series of unconstrained problems and add a penalty term to the objective; the difference is that the augmented Lagrangian method adds yet another term, designed to mimic a Lagrange multiplier.  The augmented Lagrangian is related to, but not identical with the method of Lagrange multipliers.
